details:
Non-maintainer upload by the Squeeze LTS and Kernel Teams.


New upstream stable release 2.6.32.65, see
<http://lkml.org/lkml/2014/12/13/81> for more information.


The stable release 2.6.32.65 includes the following new commits compared
to the previous 2.6.32-48squeeze9 package:


* USB: whiteheat: Added bounds checking for bulk command response
 ([CVE-2014-3185](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-3185))
* net: sctp: fix panic on duplicate ASCONF chunks ([CVE-2014-3687](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-3687))
* net: sctp: fix remote memory pressure from excessive queueing
 ([CVE-2014-3688](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-3688))
* udf: Avoid infinite loop when processing indirect ICBs ([CVE-2014-6410](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-6410))
* net: sctp: fix NULL pointer dereference in af->from\_addr\_param on
 malformed packet ([CVE-2014-7841](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-7841))
* mac80211: fix fragmentation code, particularly for encryption
 ([CVE-2014-8709](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-8709))
* ttusb-dec: buffer overflow in ioctl ([CVE-2014-8884](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-8884))


We recommend that you upgrade your linux-2.6 packages.


We apologize for a minor cosmetic glitch:


The following commits were already included in 2.6.32-48squeeze9 despite
claims in debian/changelog they were only fixed in 2.6.32-48squeez10:


* vlan: Don't propagate flag changes on down interfaces.
* sctp: Fix double-free introduced by bad backport in 2.6.32.62
* md/raid6: Fix misapplied backport in 2.6.32.64
* block: add missing blk\_queue\_dead() checks
* block: Fix blk\_execute\_rq\_nowait() dead queue handling
* proc connector: Delete spurious memset in proc\_exit\_connector()
